Description: THE COMMISSION WAS FORMED IN 1980 BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLES OF MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA TO ASSIST THE STATES IN COOPERATIVELY MANAGING THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.  IN 1985, THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA JOINED THE COMMISSION.  THE COMMISSION IS A SIGNATORY TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AGREEMENT, WHICH SERVES AS THE FRAMEWORK FOR THE MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM. THE COMMISSION SERVES AS THE LEGISLATIVE ARM OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AND IS THEREFORE FULLY INVOLVED IN THE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

Description: THE COMMISSION WAS FORMED IN 1980 BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLES OF MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA TO ASSIST THE STATES IN COOPERATIVELY MANAGING THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.  IN 1985, THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA JOINED THE COMMISSION.  THE COMMISSION IS A SIGNATORY TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AGREEMENT, WHICH SERVES AS THE FRAMEWORK FOR THE MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM. THE COMMISSION SERVES AS THE LEGISLATIVE ARM OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AND IS THEREFORE FULLY INVOLVED IN THE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

THE COMMISSION SERVES AS THE LEGISLATIVE ARM OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AND IS THEREFORE FULLY INVOLVED IN THE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

Description: THE COMMISSION WAS FORMED IN 1980 BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLES OF MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA TO ASSIST THE STATES IN COOPERATIVELY MANAGING THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.  IN 1985, THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA JOINED THE COMMISSION.  THE COMMISSION IS A SIGNATORY TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AGREEMENT, WHICH SERVES AS THE FRAMEWORK FOR THE MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM. THE COMMISSION SERVES AS THE LEGISLATIVE ARM OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AND IS THEREFORE FULLY INVOLVED IN THE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

Description: THE COMMISSION WAS FORMED IN 1980 BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLES OF MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA TO ASSIST THE STATES IN COOPERATIVELY MANAGING THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.  IN 1985, THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA JOINED THE COMMISSION.  THE COMMISSION IS A SIGNATORY TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AGREEMENT, WHICH SERVES AS THE FRAMEWORK FOR THE MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM. THE COMMISSION SERVES AS THE LEGISLATIVE ARM OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AND IS THEREFORE FULLY INVOLVED IN THE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

Description: THE COMMISSION WAS FORMED IN 1980 BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLES OF MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA TO ASSIST THE STATES IN COOPERATIVELY MANAGING THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.  IN 1985, THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA JOINED THE COMMISSION.  THE COMMISSION IS A SIGNATORY TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AGREEMENT, WHICH SERVES AS THE FRAMEWORK FOR THE MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM. THE COMMISSION SERVES AS THE LEGISLATIVE ARM OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AND IS THEREFORE FULLY INVOLVED IN THE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

Description: THE COMMISSION WAS FORMED IN 1980 BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLES OF MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA TO ASSIST THE STATES IN COOPERATIVELY MANAGING THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.  IN 1985, THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA JOINED THE COMMISSION.  THE COMMISSION IS A SIGNATORY TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AGREEMENT, WHICH SERVES AS THE FRAMEWORK FOR THE MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM. THE COMMISSION SERVES AS THE LEGISLATIVE ARM OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AND IS THEREFORE FULLY INVOLVED IN THE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

Grantor: MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES/RESOURCE ASSESSMENT SERVICE
Description: THE COMMISSION WAS FORMED IN 1980 BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLIES OF MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA TO ASSIST THE STATES IN COOPERATIVELY MANAGING THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.  IN 1985, THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA JOINED THE COMMISSION.  THE COMMISSION IS A SIGNATORY TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AGREEMENT, WHICH SERVES AS THE FRAMEWORK FOR THE MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM. THE COMMISSION SERVES AS THE LEGISLATIVE ARM OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AND IS THEREFORE FULLY INVOLVED IN THE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

Grantor: MARYLAND ENERGY ADMINISTRATION/LOCAL DISTRIBUTION COMPANY (LDC)
Description:
UPGRADE NATURAL GAS INFRASTRUCTURE. WASHINGTON GAS & LIGHT (WGL) WILL REMOVE THE CURRENT UTILITY METER ON LOCATION AND INSTALL INDIVIDUAL METERS FOR EACH DWELLING. THIS UPGRADE WILL BENEFIT CUSTOMERS AND RESIDENTS IN THOSE AREAS BY IMPROVING THE SAFETY AND RELIABILITY OF NATURAL GAS SERVICES TO THE OCCUPANTS OF THOSE DWELLINGS. WGL WILL ACCELERATE THE REMOVAL OF SMALL GAS OPERATOR
SYSTEMS AND POTENTIALLY INSTALL INDIVIDUAL METERS FOR EACH DWELLING AND REPLACE UNDERGROUND NATURAL GAS HOSE LINES.

Grantor: MARYLAND ENERGY ADMINISTRATION/LOCAL DISTRIBUTION COMPANY (LDC)
Description: EXPAND NATURAL GAS INFRASTRUCTURE.  CHESAPEAKE UTILITIES IS POSITIONED TO EXPAND NATURAL GAS TO EXISTING BUSINESSES, NEW BUSINESS CUSTOMERS, INDUSTRIAL PARKS AND STATE FACILITIES. USING FUNDING PROVIDED BY MEA, CHESAPEAKE UTILITIES WILL REACH NEW CUSTOMERS BOTH IN SOMERSET AND CECIL COUNTIES TO DEFRAY BOTH THE HARD AND SOFT COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH EXPANDING NATURAL GAS INFRASTRUCTURE TO CURRENTLY UNDERSERVED MARYLAND CUSTOMERS.

Grantor: MARYLAND ENERGY ADMINISTRATION/MARYLAND ANCHOR CUSTOMER PROGRAM (MACP)
Description: HELP A LOCAL, INDEPENDENT FOOD MARKET, REDUCE OPERATING COSTS AND EMISSIONS. WABASH MARKETS WILL CONVERT THEIR OPERATION TO NATURAL GAS. WABASH MARKETS WILL UPGRADE THEIR EXISTING THREE 50-TON HEAT PUMPS TO ROOFTOP UNITS WITH GAS FURNACE HEATING AND DIRECT EXPANSION COOLING.

Grantor: MARYLAND ENERGY ADMINISTRATION/MARYLAND ANCHOR CUSTOMER PROGRAM (MACP)
Description: MES WILL HELP FINANCE THE CONVERSION OF THE COMBINED HEAT AND POWER (CHP) SYSTEM AT EASTERN CORRECTIONAL INSTITUTE TO NATURAL GAS ON BEHALF OF THE MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC SAFETY AND CORRECTIONAL SERVICES.

Grantor: MARYLAND ENERGY ADMINISTRATION/MARYLAND ANCHOR CUSTOMER PROGRAM (MACP)
Description: UMES WILL CONVERT HEATING OPERATIONS TO NATURAL GAS. UMES'S FACILITY CURRENTLY USES HEATING OIL, CONVERTING TO NATURAL GAS WILL DECREASE GREENHOUSE GAS EMISSIONS BY APPROXIMATELY 500 TONS PER YEAR DISPLACING THE EQUIVALENT OF OVER 11 TANKER TRUCKS WORTH

Grantor: MARYLAND ENERGY ADMINISTRATION/MARYLAND COST IN AID OF CONSTRUCTION DISPENSATION FUND (CDF)
Description: EXPAND NATURAL GAS INFRASTRUCTURE IN STATE. WGL HAS IDENTIFIED THREE FREDERICK COUNTY PUBLIC SCHOOLS AS WELL AS A TARGETED CONVERSION PROGRAM, AND A MAIN ALLOWANCE PROGRAM THAT WOULD USE CIAC FUNDING. THE TARGETED CONVERSION AND MAIN ALLOWANCE PROGRAM WOULD BE ABLE TO ASSIST CUSTOMERS IN CALVERT, CHARLES, FREDERICK, MONTGOMERY, PRINCE GEORGE’S AND ST. MARY’S COUNTIES. THE TARGETED CONVERSION PROGRAM WILL BE USED TO MITIGATE THE COST TO CONVERT CUSTOMERS TO NATURAL GAS WITHIN A TARGETED GEOGRAPHIC AREA, PARTICULARLY WHEN AN EXTENSION OF THE MAIN LINE IS REQUIRED. THE MAIN ALLOWANCE PROGRAM WOULD BE USED TO MITIGATE THE COST OF THE APPROACH MAIN THAT IS NEEDED TO CONNECT THE CUSTOMER TO THE COMPANY’S CLOSEST NATURAL GAS INFRASTRUCTURE.

MARYLAND ENERGY ADMINISTRATION/MARYLAND COST IN AID OF CONSTRUCTION DISPENSATION FUND (CDF)
Description: TO HELP FUND BALTIMORE GAS & ELECTRIC (BGE) PAY IT FORWARD PROGRAM, BGE WILL IDENTIFY ALL EXISTING AND NEW CONSTRUCTION BUILDINGS (BOTH RESIDENTIAL AND COMMERCIAL) WITHIN BGE’S PAY IT FORWARD FILING AND TRACK THOSE TO CONNECT TO NATURAL GAS BY JUNE 1, 2021. FOR ALL NEW NATURAL GAS CUSTOMERS WHO CONNECT TO THESE PROJECTS, INCLUDING WHO WILL CONNECT AFTER JUNE 1, 2021, THE NEW IMPACT OF THOSE CONNECTIONS WILL BE INCLUDED IN THE PROJECT'S ESTIMATED COST AS IDENTIFIED IN BGE’S PAY IT FORWARD FILING. BG&E WILL USE THE FUNDING PROVIDED BY MEA TO DEFRAY THE COST ASSOCIATED WITH INSTALLING NATURAL GAS INFRASTRUCTURE FROM THE END OF THE UTILITY’S ASSET TO THE CUSTOMER’S METER.

Grantor: MARYLAND DEPARTMENT OF NATURAL RESOURCES/RESOURCE ASSESSMENT SERVICE
Description: THE COMMISSION WAS FORMED IN 1980 BY THE GENERAL ASSEMBLES OF MARYLAND AND VIRGINIA TO ASSIST THE STATES IN COOPERATIVELY MANAGING THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.  IN 1985, THE COMMONWEALTH OF PENNSYLVANIA JOINED THE COMMISSION.  THE COMMISSION IS A SIGNATORY TO THE CHESAPEAKE BAY AGREEMENT, WHICH SERVES AS THE FRAMEWORK FOR THE MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM. THE COMMISSION SERVES AS THE LEGISLATIVE ARM OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY PROGRAM AND IS THEREFORE FULLY INVOLVED IN THE RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF THE CHESAPEAKE BAY.

Description: FUNDS ARE USED FOR THE FAMILY PRESERVATION PROGRAM TO SHORTEN THE LENGTH OF STAY FOR FOSTER CARE OF CHILDREN BETWEEN THE AGE OF ZERO AND 5 YEARS  WHO ARE PLACED IN OUT-OF-HOME  CARE FOR THE FIRST TIME.  PARENTS ARE PROVIDED WITH INTENSIVE CASE MANAGEMENT AND SUPPORT SERVICES, SUBSTANCE ABUSE TREATMENT. FREQUENT OVERSIGHT IS PROVIDED BY THE JUVENILE COURT.  FUNDS ARE ALSO USED TO PROVIDE FOOD SUPPLEMENT OUTREACH PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDES MONTHLY BENEFITS TO ELIGIBLE LOW-INCOME INDIVIDUALS AND FAMILIES TO HELP THEM PURCHASE FOOD, PROVIDE NUTRITIONAL EDUCATION, PRE-SCREENING, APPLICATION ASSISTANCE AND FOLLOW-UP.

Grantee: NATIONAL CENTER FOR INSTITUTIONS AND ALTERNATIVES
Grantee_Clean: NATIONAL CENTER FOR INSTITUTIONS AND ALTERNATIVES
Description: EARN MARYLAND IS A STATE-FUNDED, COMPETITIVE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT GRANT PROGRAM THAT IS INDUSTRY-LED, REGIONAL IN FOCUS, AND A PROVEN STRATEGY FOR HELPING BUSINESSES CULTIVATE THE SKILLED WORKFORCE THEY NEED TO COMPETE. IT IS FLEXIBLE AND INNOVATIVE, DESIGNED TO ENSURE THAT MARYLAND EMPLOYERS HAVE THE TALENT THEY NEED TO COMPETE AND GROW IN AN EVER-CHANGING 21ST CENTURY ECONOMY.

Grantor: GOVERNOR'S OFFICE OF CRIME PREVENTION, YOUTH, AND VICTIM SERVICES/P50AS JUVENILE STATE MATCH REQUIREMENT
Description: THE PUBLIC JUSTICE CENTER’S EDUCATION STABILITY PROJECT SEEKS TO COMBAT THE ILLEGAL AND OTHERWISE EXCESSIVE USE OF SUSPENSION, EXPULSION, SCHOOL-BASED ARREST, AND OTHER FORMS OF SCHOOL PUSHOUT IN MARYLAND’S PUBLIC SCHOOLS, WHICH CAUSE YOUTH – PARTICULARLY YOUTH OF COLOR – TO BECOME NEEDLESSLY INVOLVED WITH THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM. OUR PROGRAM WILL PURSUE THIS BROAD PURPOSE THROUGH (1) THE PROVISION OF LEGAL REPRESENTATION TO STUDENTS IN DISCIPLINE PROCEEDINGS, (2) OUTREACH AND EDUCATION TO YOUTH, PARENTS AND FAMILY SERVICE PROVIDERS ON THE RIGHTS OF STUDENTS FACING EXCLUSIONARY DISCIPLINE, AND (3) ADVOCACY TO REFORM THE POLICIES AND PRACTICES THAT RESULT IN SCHOOL PUSHOUT. THUS, THE PROGRAM AIMS TO “REDUCE THE NUMBER OF JUVENILES ENTERING THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM BY PROVIDING SUPPORTIVE SERVICES” AND ADVOCACY WITH STATE AND LOCAL SCHOOL SYSTEMS “WITHIN THE COMMUNITIES IN WHICH THEY RESIDE,” FURTHERING THE TITLE II PROGRAM PURPOSE AREA AROUND THE DELIVERY OF COMMUNITY-BASED PROGRAMS AND SERVICES.

Grantor: GOVERNOR'S OFFICE OF CRIME PREVENTION, YOUTH, AND VICTIM SERVICES/P50AS JUVENILE STATE MATCH REQUIREMENT
Description: THE CENTER FOR CHILDREN'S "A CONTINUUM OF SERVICES FOR CHILDREN AND YOUTH 3- 24" PROJECT WILL SERVE A CONTINUUM OF YOUTH AT HIGH RISK TO BE INVOLVED WITH THE JUVENILE JUSTICE SYSTEM AND THOSE WHO ARE ALREADY INVOLVED OR HAVE BEEN INVOLVED IN THE JUVENILE SERVICES SYSTEM. THERE ARE THREE COMPONENTS TO THE PROJECT: 1) PARENT CHILD INTERACTION THERAPY (PCIT) TARGETING YOUNGER CHILDREN; 2) FUNCTIONAL FAMILY THERAPY TARGETING YOUTH 11-17, NOT ALREADY INVOLVED IN DJS, BUT AT RISK TO BECOME INVOLVED; AND 3) THE YOUTH INTERVENTION AND ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM TARGETING DISCONNECTED YOUTH AGES 16-24. PROJECT FUNDS PROVIDE PERSONNEL, OPERATING, TRAVEL, CONTRACTUAL, EQUIPMENT AND OTHER.

Description: THE MARYLAND COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT (MCASA) SEXUAL ASSAULT LEGAL INSTITUTE—CRIME SURVIVORS INITIATIVE (SALI-CSI) PROGRAM HELPS REDUCE EXISTING GAPS IN SERVICES, INCLUDING THOSE THAT HAVE BEEN COMPOUNDED BY THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC, WHILE FOSTERING COLLABORATION AND COOPERATION AMONG STAKEHOLDERS THROUGHOUT MARYLAND. THE SALI-CSI PROGRAM IS A STATEWIDE LEGAL SERVICES PROGRAM FOR VICTIMS OF SEXUAL CRIMES INVOLVED WITH THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM WHICH COMPLEMENTS SALI'S EXISTING CIVIL LEGAL SERVICES BY INCREASING REPRESENTATION AND ENFORCEMENT OF CRIME VICTIMS' RIGHTS IN STATE, JUVENILE, AND FEDERAL CRIMINAL MATTERS.  PROGRAM FUNDS PROVIDE PERSONNEL, OPERATING EXPENSES, AND TRAVEL.

Description: THE SEXUAL ASSAULT/SPOUSE ABUSE RESOURCE CENTER, INC.'S PROTECTIVE ORDER ADVOCACY AND REPRESENTATION PROJECT PROVIDES DIRECT SERVICES TO ENGLISH AND NON-ENGLISH SPEAKING VICTIMS OF DOMESTIC VIOLENCE, SEXUAL ASSAULT, AND STALKING IN HARFORD COUNTY SEEKING PROTECTION FROM ABUSE THROUGH THE MARYLAND JUDICIARY. THROUGH THE PROGRAM, LEGAL ADVOCATES AND ATTORNEYS ASSIST VICTIMS IN COMPLETING PETITIONS FOR PROTECTION AND DEVELOPING INDIVIDUALIZED SAFETY PLANS. ADVOCATES CONDUCT INTAKES, GATHER EVIDENCE, AND PROVIDE SUPPORT TO VICTIMS AND ATTORNEYS IN PEACE/PROTECTIVE ORDER AND CRIMINAL PROCEEDINGS WHILE ATTORNEYS PROVIDE LEGAL REPRESENTATION FOR CRIME VICTIMS IN PROTECTIVE ORDER HEARINGS.

Description: THE MARYLAND COALITION AGAINST SEXUAL ASSAULT’S SEXUAL ASSAULT LEGAL INSTITUTE COVID-19 RESPONSE—UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS ADVOCATES (SALI-UP) PROJECT SEEKS TO PROVIDE DIRECT LEGAL SERVICES RESPONSIVE TO THE NEEDS OF UNDERSERVED VICTIM/SURVIVORS OF SEXUAL ASSAULT IN THE WAKE OF THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. SALI-UP WILL PROVIDE PARTIAL SUPPORT FOR TWO BILINGUAL LEGAL ADVOCATES—ONE WHO FOCUSES ON POPULATIONS IN PRINCE GEORGE’S COUNTY AND THE OTHER WHO WORKS STATEWIDE—TO WORK WITH VICTIM/SURVIVORS OF SEXUAL ASSAULT, CHILD SEXUAL ABUSE, AND HUMAN SEX TRAFFICKING. THE BILINGUAL ADVOCATES PROVIDE ADVOCACY AND ACCOMPANIMENT, SAFETY PLANNING, INCLUDING FINANCIAL SAFETY PLANNING, INITIAL INTAKE, COORDINATION OF VIRTUAL SERVICE DELIVERY METHODS, AND SUPPORT FOR ATTORNEYS PROVIDING DIRECT LEGAL REPRESENTATION OF VICTIM/SURVIVORS FROM UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS.

THE PROJECT WILL INSTALL PEDESTRIAN AND/OR VEHICULAR FENCING TO PROTECT THE SCHOOL'S STUDENTS, STAFF AND VISITORS. PROGRAM FUNDS WILL PAY FOR CONTRACTOR TO INSTALL FENCING.

THE PROGRAM WILL PROVIDE A SAFE LEARNING ENVIRONMENT FOR STUDENTS WITHIN A SECURE LOCATION AND WILL PREVENT UNAUTHORIZED PERSONS FROM ENTERING THE SCHOOL CAMPUS, ESPECIALLY WHILE THE CHILDREN ARE PRESENT. Description: THE ANNE ARUNDEL COUNTY COMMUNITY ACTION AGENCY (AACCAA) IS IMPLEMENTING HOUSING COORDINATOR FOR RETURNING CITIZENS -COMMUNITY REENTRY TO PROVIDE QUALITY HOUSING SUPPORT SERVICES IN ANNE ARUNDEL COUNTY FOR BOOSTING SUCCESSFUL COMMUNITY-BASED RE-ENTRY AND REDUCING THE RATES AT WHICH OFFENDERS RETURN TO CRIME. THE PROPOSED PROGRAM ALIGNS WITH JRCC RECOMMENDATIONS TO (1) “EXPAND PROGRAMMING OPTIONS FOR INDIVIDUALS LEAVING PRISON AND RE-ENTERING THE COMMUNITY, SPECIFICALLY COMMUNITY-BASED HOUSING SERVICES, AND (2) CREATE TRANSITION COORDINATION TO PROVIDE QUALITY TRANSITION PLANNING AND HOUSING SUPPORTS FOR OFFENDERS UPON THEIR RELEASE FROM PRISON. PROGRAM FUNDS PROVIDE TRAINING, CONTRACTUAL SERVICES, EQUIPMENT AND, OPERATING COSTS.

Grantor: GOVERNOR'S OFFICE OF CRIME PREVENTION, YOUTH, AND VICTIM SERVICES/PPIGF PERFORMANCE INCENTIVE GRANT PROGRAM
Description: GATEKEEPERS’ MISSION IS TO MOTIVATE, EMPOWER, AND ENCOURAGE EX-OFFENDERS THROUGH COACHING: CHALLENGING INDIVIDUALS TO MAKE POSITIVE CHOICES THAT WILL FACILITATE A SUCCESSFUL TRANSITION BACK TO THE COMMUNITY. GATEKEEPERS APPROACHES RE-ENTRY FROM A COMPASSIONATE PERSPECTIVE CALLED THE BUSINESS OF LIVING. CENTRAL TO THE BUSINESS OF LIVING PROCESS IS DEVELOPMENT OF A PERSONALIZED RE-ENTRY PLAN FOCUSING ON FOUR ASPECTS OF HUMAN DEVELOPMENT: EDUCATIONAL, OCCUPATIONAL, PERSONAL AND SPIRITUAL. THIS PROGRAM (SIXTY DAY CLIENT STABILIZATION SUPPORT) BUILDS ON GATEKEEPERS' WORK IS RESPONSIVE TO CLIENT BASIC NEEDS AT THE START OF THE COMMUNITY RE-ENTRY PROCESS. PROGRAM FUNDS WILL PROVIDE TRAINING, EQUIPMENT AND PERSONNEL.

Description: THE COMMUNITY ADVOCATES FOR FAMILY & YOUTH (CAFY) IMPROVED SUPPORT FOR SURVIVORS OF HOMICIDE VICTIMS - VICTIM SERVICES PROFESSIONALS - PRINCE GEORGE’S COUNTY (ISSOHV) PROGRAM HELPS TO ENSURE THAT HUNDREDS OF SURVIVORS HARMED BY A HOMICIDE DURING THE GRANT PERIOD ARE CONTACTED AND HAVE HELP ACCESSING VICTIM SERVICES, MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING, LEGAL ASSISTANCE AND OTHER SERVICES IN PRINCE GEORGE’S COUNTY, MD. THE MAIN FUNCTION OF THE REQUEST IS TO CONCENTRATE STAFF AND RESOURCES TO BETTER REACH AND ASSIST FAMILIES, SPOUSES, CHILDREN AND OTHERS WHO ARE AFFECTED BY THE HOMICIDE OF A LOVED ONE WITH CASE MANAGEMENT, MENTAL HEALTH COUNSELING AND OTHER SERVICES TO ENHANCE SELF-SUFFICIENCY AS WELL AS ACHIEVE RESTORATION AND RESILIENCY. PROGRAM FUNDS PROVIDE FOR PERSONNEL.

Grantor: GOVERNOR'S OFFICE OF CRIME PREVENTION, YOUTH, AND VICTIM SERVICES/PSOHG SURVIVORS OF HOMICIDE GRANT
Description: ROBERTA’S HOUSE’S MULTI-SITE HOMICIDE SURVIVOR TRANSFORMATION PROJECT PROVIDES DIRECT VICTIM SERVICES IN GREATER METROPOLITAN BALTIMORE AND PRINCE GEORGE’S COUNTY. THE MULTI-SITE HOMICIDE SURVIVOR TRANSFORMATION PROJECT PROVIDES SERVICES TO SURVIVORS OF HOMICIDE VICTIMS, INCLUSIVE OF GRIEF SUPPORT AND ADVOCACY ASSISTANCE. THE PROGRAM FACILITATES HEALING AND RECOVERY FROM TRAUMATIC LOSS. PROGRAM FUNDS PROVIDE FOR PERSONNEL.

Grantor: GOVERNOR'S OFFICE OF CRIME PREVENTION, YOUTH, AND VICTIM SERVICES/PVIPA BALTO CHESAPEAKE BAY
Grantee: BALTIMORE CHESAPEAKE BAY OUTWARD BOUND CENTER INC.
Grantee_Clean: BALTIMORE CHESAPEAKE BAY OUTWARD BOUND CENTER INC.
Description: THE CHESAPEAKE BAY OUTWARD BOUND SCHOOL’S POLICE YOUTH CHALLENGE (PYC) PROGRAM IS FOCUSED ON CONNECTING THE BALTIMORE POLICE DEPARTMENT AND BALTIMORE YOUTH IN SAFE AND FACILITATED ENVIRONMENTS TO FOSTER TRUST. THE FY22 PYC PROGRAM WILL CREATE IN-PERSON OPPORTUNITIES FOR DEEPER AND MULTIPLE INTERACTIONS BETWEEN POLICE OFFICER TRAINEES AND SCHOOL-AGE YOUTH BY LEVERAGING OUTDOOR EXPERIENTIAL ACTIVITIES. THE PYC PROGRAM BENEFITS THE ENTIRE BALTIMORE COMMUNITY BY INCORPORATING FOUNDATIONAL TRAINING FOR ACADEMY TRAINEES ON INTERACTING WITH YOUTH AND CREATING SPACE FOR YOUTH TO ENGAGE WITH POLICE TRAINEES. PROGRAM FUNDS PROVIDE FOR PERSONNEL, OPERATING EXPENSES, TRAVEL, SERVICES AND PROGRAMMATIC MATERIALS.

Grantor: GOVERNOR'S OFFICE OF CRIME PREVENTION, YOUTH, AND VICTIM SERVICES/PVIPB BALTIMORE CITY LEAD
Description: BEHAVIORAL HEALTH SYSTEM BALTIMORE’S (BHSB) LAW ENFORCEMENT ASSISTED DIVERSION (LEAD) PROGRAM HELPS REDUCE EXISTING GAPS IN SERVICES AND FOSTER COLLABORATION AND COOPERATION AMONG PARTNER AGENCIES AND STAKEHOLDERS THROUGHOUT BALTIMORE CITY. LEAD IS A PRE-BOOKING DIVERSION PROGRAM THAT ALLOWS LAW ENFORCEMENT TO IMMEDIATELY CONNECT ELIGIBLE PARTICIPANTS, GENERALLY THOSE DIAGNOSED WITH SUBSTANCE-USE DISORDERS AND MENTAL ILLNESSES, WITH INTENSIVE CASE MANAGEMENT, DELIVERED IN A HARM REDUCTION FRAMEWORK, RATHER THAN HAVING THEM BECOME ENMESHED IN THE CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM. LEAD WILL RESULT IN DECREASED CRIMINAL JUSTICE SYSTEM UTILIZATION AND COST, BETTER PARTICIPANT OUTCOMES, AND IMPROVED RELATIONS BETWEEN LAW ENFORCEMENT AND COMMUNITY. THESE PROGRAM FUNDS WILL SUPPORT LEAD INTENSIVE CASE MANAGEMENT SERVICES THROUGH CONTRACTUAL SERVICES.
